Ekaterina Ilin

I‚Äôm an astrophysicist studying the magnetic activity of low-mass stars and how it interacts with their orbiting planets. I focus on how stellar magnetism shapes planetary environments, using flares, X-ray and radio signals to trace these interactions. My work combines time-domain observations from space telescopes like TESS and CHEOPS with physical modeling and statistical methods.

I hold a PhD in astrophysics from the Leibniz Institute for Astrophysics Potsdam and currently work as a postdoctoral researcher at the Netherlands Institute for Radio Astronomy (ASTRON). I‚Äôm also active in mentoring, teaching, and public outreach.
Feel free to explore my CV or read more about my research and publications.
